intro: Melampyrum argyrocomum, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, commonly referred to as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Silverweed is known for its ability to form dense colonies and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
